title: 16 injured in shooting at park in 9th Ward, NOPD says
content:
NEW ORLEANS —
New Orleans police are investigating a shooting that left 16 people injured Sunday night at Bunny Friend Playground.
Authorities said several hundred people were gathered at the playground at 1903 Desire St. at about 6:15 p.m. for an unauthorized block party when two groups began shooting at each other.
Witnesses told police that both groups left the park on foot immediately after the gunfire.
Police, who were already on their way to the playground to break up the crowd after learning of the event, arrived immediately after the shooting occurred.
Officers worked quickly to control the crowd and identify victims.
Ten victims were taken to hospitals by ambulances. Police later learned an additional six victims arrived to area hospitals in private vehicles.
Detectives are still working to determine the extent of all of the injuries.
Investigators are combing the neighborhood for any surveillance video of the incident and/or shooters.
Anyone with information or videos that they believe may be helpful to the investigation should call the New Orleans Police Department immediately at 658-6050.
Tipsters can also call Crime Stoppers at 822-1111 or toll-free 1-877-903-STOP, or leave an anonymous tip on the Crime Stoppers website.
Tipsters could receive a cash reward of up to $2,500.
